NXT Commands
NXT Commands.

Low-level NXT commands. Each command sends a single message to the brick.

(void) - startProgram:
 Start a Stored Program.
(void) - stopProgram
 Stop a Running Program.
(void) - getCurrentProgramName
 Get Running Program Name.
(void) - playSoundFile:loop:
 Play a Sound File.
(void) - playTone:duration:
 Play a Tone.
(void) - stopSoundPlayback
 Stop Sound Playback.

 Servo Control.

 Get Servo Output State.

NXT Methods
High-level NXT methods Methods consisting of several NXT commands.

Some of which set timers for polling or keep-alive.

(void) - keepAlive
 Keep Brick From Powering Down.
(void) - setupTouchSensor:
 Configures touch sensor on given port.
(void) - setupSoundSensor:adjusted:
 Configures sound sensor in given port.
(void) - setupLightSensor:active:
 Configures light sensor on given port.
(void) - setupUltrasoundSensor:continuous:
 Configures the ultrasound sensor.
(void) - getUltrasoundByte:byte:
 Get Untrasound Reading.
(void) - pollSensor:interval:
 Poll Sensor Values.
(void) - pollUltrasoundSensor:interval:
 Poll Ultrasound Distance.
(void) - pollKeepAlive
 Poll Keep Alive.
(void) - pollBatteryLevel:
 Poll Battery Lebel.
(void) - pollServo:interval:
 Poll Servo Values.
(void) - stopAllTimers
 Stop all Polling Timers.
(void) - moveServo:power:tacholimit:
 Move a Servo.
(void) - stopServos
 Stop All Servos.

00254                 // Something went bad (looking at the error codes I can also say what, but for the moment let's not dwell on
00255                 // those details). If the device connection is left open close it and return an error:
00256                 NSLog( @"Error - open sequence failed.***\n" );
00257                 [self close:device];
00258                 return FALSE;
00259         }

00262         [mBluetoothDevice  retain];

- (void) getUltrasoundByte: (UInt8)  port
byte: (UInt8)  byte 

Get Untrasound Reading.

Fetches a single ultrasound reading. If you are using continuous mode, byte will always be 0. Call setupUltrasoundSensor:()continuous before using this method.

- (void) LSGetStatus: (UInt8)  port  

Get Low-Speed Buffer Status.

Use this to determine if the LS device has data to send. When requesting data with LSWrite, use this method to determine when the data is ready. This often results in a kNXTPendingCommunication error status, which only means the data is not yet ready.

The easiest way to work with this method is to call LSRead within the delegate's NXTLSGetStatus method. To call LSGetStatus in loop when data is not ready, catch kNXTPendingCommunication in delegate's NXTOperationError method and re-call LSGetStatus.

Definition at line 722 of file LegoNXT.m.

References kNXTLSGetStatus, kNXTRet, and NXT_ASSERT_SENSOR_PORT.

00722                    :(UInt8)port
00723 {
00724     NXT_ASSERT_SENSOR_PORT(port);
00725     
00726     char message[] = {
00727         kNXTRet,
00728         kNXTLSGetStatus,
00729         port
00730     };
00731     
00732     // send the message
00733     [self sendMessage:message length:3];
00734 }

- (void) LSRead: (UInt8)  port  

Read Data from Low-Speed Device.

Reads 16 bytes of 0-padded data from a low-speed device. This is usually called from the delegate's NXTLSGetStatus method when bytesReady is greater than 0. Take care to always read data when it is ready, as the buffer on the ultrasound sensor will overflow, resulting in a garbled message.

Definition at line 752 of file LegoNXT.m.

References kNXTLSRead, kNXTRet, and NXT_ASSERT_SENSOR_PORT.

00752               :(UInt8)port
00753 {
00754     NXT_ASSERT_SENSOR_PORT(port);
00755     
00756     char message[] = {
00757         kNXTRet,
00758         kNXTLSRead,
00759         port
00760     };
00761     
00762     [self pushLsReadQueue:port];
00763     [self sendMessage:message length:3];
00764 }

- (void) LSWrite: (UInt8)  port
txLength: (UInt8)  txLength
rxLength: (UInt8)  rxLength
txData: (void*)  txData 

Write Data to Low-Speed Device.

Writes data to the LS device. Port must be kNXTSensor4. Data length is liited to 16 bytes. This is usually followed by LSGetStatus:port.

Definition at line 736 of file LegoNXT.m.

References kNXTLSWrite, kNXTRet, and NXT_ASSERT_SENSOR_PORT.

Referenced by getUltrasoundByte:byte:, and setupUltrasoundSensor:continuous:.

00739     char message[5+txLength];
00740     
00741     message[0] = kNXTRet;
00742     message[1] = kNXTLSWrite;
00743     message[2] = port;
00744     message[3] = txLength;
00745     message[4] = rxLength;
00746     
00747     memcpy(message+5, txData, txLength);
00748     
00749     [self sendMessage:message length:(5+txLength)];

Move a Servo.

Move a servo at a given power to the set tacho limit. If limit is 0, move indefinately.

- (void) playSoundFile: (NSString*)  soundfile
loop: (BOOL)  loop 

Play a Sound File.

Plays a sound file stored on the brick. Sound file names always end in ".rso". For example: "Woops.rso".

- (void) pollSensor: (UInt8)  port
interval: (NSTimeInterval)  seconds 

Poll Sensor Values.

Polls a sensor with getInputValues:port every interval. This does not work for low-speed sensors, such as the ultrasound.

Definition at line 824 of file LegoNXT.m.

References NXT_ASSERT_SENSOR_PORT, and sensorTimers.

00824                   :(UInt8)port interval:(NSTimeInterval)seconds
00825 {
00826     NXT_ASSERT_SENSOR_PORT(port);
00827     [self invalidateSensorTimer:port];
00828     
00829     if ( seconds > 0 )
00830     {
00831         NSLog(@"pollSensor: starting poll timer");
00832         sensorTimers[port] = [[NSTimer scheduledTimerWithTimeInterval:seconds
00833                                                                target:self
00834                                                              selector:@selector(doSensorPoll:)
00835                                                              userInfo:[NSData dataWithBytes:&port length:1]
00836                                                               repeats:YES] retain];
00837     }
00838 }

- (void) pollUltrasoundSensor: (UInt8)  port
interval: (NSTimeInterval)  seconds 

Poll Ultrasound Distance.

Similar to pollSensor, this polls the ultrasound sensor at a regular interval. Call setupUltrasoundSensor:()continuous before using this method. Take care not to poll too frequently, as polling the ultrasound generates a lot of chatter and may overwhelm the brick.

Definition at line 840 of file LegoNXT.m.

References NXT_ASSERT_SENSOR_PORT, and sensorTimers.

00840                             :(UInt8)port interval:(NSTimeInterval)seconds
00841 {
00842     NXT_ASSERT_SENSOR_PORT(port);
00843     [self invalidateSensorTimer:port]; 
00844     
00845     if ( seconds > 0 )
00846         sensorTimers[port] = [[NSTimer scheduledTimerWithTimeInterval:seconds
00847                                                                target:self
00848                                                              selector:@selector(doUltrasoundPoll:)
00849                                                              userInfo:[NSData dataWithBytes:&port length:1]
00850                                                               repeats:YES] retain];
00851 }

- (void) setupSoundSensor: (UInt8)  port
adjusted: (BOOL)  adjusted 

Configures sound sensor in given port.

If sensor is adjusted, it will only hear sounds within the human-audible range.

- (void) startProgram: (NSString*)  program  

Start a Stored Program.

Starts a program stored on the brick. Program names always end in ".rxe". For example: "Untitled-1.rxe".
